Detailed Description

A load-filter message.

Upon receiving a load-filter message, the remote peer will immediately restrict the broadcast transactions it announces (in inventory messages) to transactions matching the filter, where the matching algorithm is specified below. The flags control the update behaviour of the matching algorithm.

Note
This message is related to bloom filtering of connections and is defined in BIP 0037.
See also
FilterAddMessage, FilterClearMessage, MerkleBlockMessage

Member Data Documentation

std::vector<uint8_t> Network::FilterLoadMessage::filter_

The filter itself is simply a bit field of arbitrary byte-aligned size.

The maximum size is < 36,000 bytes.

uint8_t Network::FilterLoadMessage::flags_

A set of flags that control how matched items are added to the filter.

uint32_t Network::FilterLoadMessage::nHashFuncs_

The number of hash functions to use in this filter.

The maximum value allowed in this field < is 50.

uint32_t Network::FilterLoadMessage::tweak_

A random value to add to the seed value in the hash function used by the bloom filter.
